summary: Ep.30 Is Denzel Washington Taking Advantage Of Nerds?
title: Ep.30 Is Denzel Washington Taking Advantage Of Nerds?
body:
This weeks episode we run through a couple highlights from Gamescon 2018 like diablo 3 for switch and the new overwatch map and animated short. While talking about overwatch LJ release a little bit of frustration to the world talking about ranked. Then we talk about Denzel Washington and what superhero he should play,if any at all. We also talk about why celebrities want to be superheroes in the first place. 

This episode was bought to you by Everything Vogue Black Market the brand that supports your inner boss.

8bitclosedfist.com


New episode out now!

summary: Iron Fist Season 2 Preview Focuses In On Stunts
title: Iron Fist Season 2 Preview Focuses In On Stunts
body:
Iron Fist Season 2 Preview Focuses In On Stunts

If there is one complaint about the first season of Iron Fist the production took to heart, it was in the way its stunts and fights were executed. They were sort of terrible. But as seen in this preview of the second season, stars Finn Jones and Jessica Henwick, along with new stunt coordinator Clayton Barber, dedicated themselves to making the fights much, much better. And considering this is

View On WordPress

title: Just a Joust? (Chapter 2)
body:
Summary: As the king’s only daughter, you are next in line to ascend the throne of Shieldlünd. Although he knows you are capable of ruling the kingdom on your own, Royal Protocol states that you must take a husband before being allowed to reign. And so, a jousting tournament is arranged, with an assortment of handsome, eligible bachelors slated to battle for your hand in marriage.

Pairing: Knight!Steve x Princess!Reader (Plus other Avengers vying for your heart)

Words: 1553

A/N: I started this series before Call Me Doctor. and haven’t shown it much love, so I finally wrote Chapter 2. Royal AU because who doesn’t want to feel like a princess, ya know?

Catch Up On the Story Here

You walked with Natasha to the grand staircase, trying to prepare yourself for what was to come. You met your mother and father at the bottom of the staircase. Your mother held a tiara in her hands and delicately placed it upon your head. She gently held your face between her hands and gave you a loving smile. Your father hugged you tightly. Lord Coulson entered the room and bowed.

“Are we ready, Your Majesties?” he asked, rising from his bow.

“I believe so,” your father said, releasing your from his hug.

“Even if we aren’t, we have to do this anyway,” you muttered under your breath.

“Then we shall begin,” Coulson took Natasha’s arm in his own and led the way to the balcony, which overlooked the jousting field. “There is a quite the display of suitors, your highness, hopefully one will be adequate.”

You could hear cheers and yells coming from outside, and you began to feel nervous for the first time since the idea was proposed. A fanfare of trumpets began and Lord Coulson walked out onto the small stage built just for the occasion.

“Ladies and Gentleman,” he announced to the crowd, “May I present to you, His Majesty, King Nicholas and Her Majesty, Queen Maria of Shieldlünd.”

Your mother and father both kissed you on the cheek and proceeded onto the balcony to applause.

“I now have the distinct pleasure of introducing the fair maiden for whom we are all gathered: Her Royal Highness, Princess (Y/N) of Shieldlünd.”

There was silence as you walked onto the stage, holding your head high and your shoulders back. You looked out over the field and couldn’t believe the sheer amount of people who had gathered for the joust. Thunderous applause erupted as you turned to face the crowd and you made a small curtsey to them, feeling your cheeks start to blush. You took your seat and looked over the people gathered for the joust. You couldn’t see anyone in armour and turned to question your parents when Lord Coulson began to speak again.

“Your Majesties, if I may now present to the Princess the men competing for her hand in marriage?”

“Proceed,” King Nicholas directed with a wave of his hand.

“I present to you: Master James Rhodes of Philadelphus, Master Bruce Banner of Virginiandia, Sir Samuel Wilson of Washingshire, Sir James Barnes of Indianatan, Sir Steven Rogers of Brooklandia, Lord Anthony of York Newshire, and Prince Loki Laufeyson of Jotunland, Prince Thor Odinson of Asgardus.”

The 8 men rode out upon their horses to varying amounts of cheers from the crowd. You moved to the edge of your seat to get the best view of the men, although each man had his helmet on with the visor down, so you had no indication of what any of them really looked like.

“The day will begin with trials to allow our competitors time to warm-up after their long journeys to Shieldlünd. The official jousting competition will begin tomorrow. The pairings for the competition will be Prince Laufeyson versus Prince Odinson, Sir Rogers versus Master Rhodes, Lord Stark versus Master Banner, and Sir Wilson versus Sir Barnes,” Coulson announced, “For now, let the practice begin, for tomorrow, the competition commences!”

The spectators cheered and each knight bowed to you before grabbing a weapon or mounting a horse to begin the day of trials.

“I have approved each of the competitors to have small breaks to come and introduce themselves to Your Highness individually,” Coulson told you and your parents, nodding at you.

“And you have invited them to the welcoming feast?” Queen Maria asked.

“Of course, Your Majesty,” Coulson bowed.

“Welcoming feast?” you asked with a raised eyebrow.

“Um yes, it is customary to have a feast to celebrate a joust,” King Nicholas replied, “Did we forget to tell you that?” he asked with a sheepish grin.

“As you promised just a joust, I believe you did leave that out,” you crossed your arms and slumped back in your chair annoyed.

“Sit up,” Queen Maria nudged you, “One of the competitors is coming over.”

You quickly sat up and smoothed your dress down as a knight in golden armor with red feather plumes in his helmet approached the balcony. You offered him your hand as he approached and he slowly removed his helmet before taking your hand and kissing it, making direct eye contact as he did.

“Your Highness,” he bowed to you, “I am Lord Anthony Stark of York Newshire. I have heard of your beauty, but the stories are nothing compared to what I see before me.”

“Well that is very kind, Lord Stark,” you blushed, “And I am privy to your skills on the battlefield and wait with bated breath to see you joust this week.”

“I hope that I may live up to such high praises and high expectations,” Lord Stark grinned before bowing, replacing his helmet, and returning to his horse.

“I assume you’ve also heard of his skills in the bedroom,” Natasha whispered in your ear.

“Who hasn’t?” you giggled back.

“Girls, compose yourselves,” your mother snapped at you, “Another one is coming.”

Sure enough, another knight was making his way towards you. This one wore armor that was completely black, save for his left arm, which was silver. The feather plumes in his helmet were red.

You extend your hand to him.

“Princess (Y/N),” he removed his helmet and kissed your hand, “It is a pleasure to finally meet you. I am Sir James Barnes of Indianatan,” he bowed to you.

“Sir Barnes, it is a pleasure to make your acquaintance,” you nodded to him.

“The pleasure is all mine, Princess. To allow my eyes to fall upon such beauty is a true honor.”

“Thank you, Sir Barnes,” you blushed, “I look forward to watching you in the tournament. I’ve heard stories of the Winter Soldier leading troops into battle.”

“The Winter Soldier stories are much more violent than what really occurred,” Sir Barnes blushed, “Until tonight,” he kissed your hand again and walked away.

Another competitor in dark grey armor with red detailing approached the stage as soon as Sir Barnes walked away. He removed his helmet and kissed the hand you offered to him.

“Your Highness,” he bowed to you, “I am Sir Samuel Wilson of Washingshire. While we may be in competition, there is no competition for your beauty anywhere else in the surrounding lands and beyond.”

“Thank you, Sir Wilson,” you forced yourself to suppress a sigh of annoyance.

“I anxiously await the opportunity to show you my skills in jousting and combat.”

“I look forward to seeing them,” you replied.

Sir Wilson kissed your hand again and returned to the training in the middle of the field.

Throughout the afternoon each competitor came to introduce themselves to you, and each one continued to compliment your beauty and nothing else.

“I swear if I have to hear about how beautiful I am one more time I’m competing in this tournament myself and immediately declaring myself the winner,” you sighed.

“At least they’ve all been easy on the eyes themselves,” Natasha shrugged.

“You have one last competitor to meet. Maybe he will impress you?” King Nicholas said hopefully as the last knight approached you.

He wore stunning white armor that had detailings in red and blue and had matching feathers in his helmet. He lifted his helmet off as he came towards you, releasing flowing blonde hair and a dark beard. You felt a shiver run up your spine and your face turn hot as you offered him your hand.

“Princess (Y/N),” he closed his eyes and tenderly kissed your hand. “When I heard the news that kingdom was hosting a joust, I knew I had to compete for the opportunity to be privy, even for a short time, to your reputable intelligence and wit. I am Sir Steven Rogers of Brooklandia. I have also been told of your great skill in swordplay and combat. Perhaps one day I will be able to see it for myself.”

You blushed considerably, “Perhaps if I deem your skills on the battlefield worthy, I will personally duel you, Sir Rogers. And I must apologize, but I don’t believe I have heard much of your own prowess.”

“For quite some time I have been living a nomadic life, helping those who most needed it and traveling from place to place to do so. Unlike my many fierce competitors, I fear I have not made a name for myself in jousting; however, I do believe I have the skills necessary to be a worthy opponent.”

“So you are a Robin Hood sort of character?” you asked quizzically.

“I suppose so,” he replied with a booming laugh.

“Well, I quite look forward to seeing you compete,” you gave him a large smile.

“I look forward to being able to show off for you,” he said, matching your grin before bowing to you and your parents and returning to the weapons to begin sparring with Sir Wilson.

“Coulson, ensure that Sir Rogers sits next to the Princess at dinner this evening,” Queen Maria told the Lord.

“As you wish, M’Lady,” he replied.

“Perhaps dinner won’t be so bad after all,” you quietly mused to yourself.


Permanent Tag List:

@sophiealiice

“Well that is very kind, Lord Stark,” you blushed, “And I am privy to your skills on the battlefield and wait with bated breath to see you joust this week.”

“I hope that I may live up to such high praises and high expectations,” Lord Stark grinned before bowing, replacing his helmet, and returning to his horse.

“I assume you’ve also heard of his skills in the bedroom,” Natasha whispered in your ear.

“Who hasn’t?” you giggled back.

“Girls, compose yourselves,” your mother snapped at you, “Another one is coming.”

Sure enough, another knight was making his way towards you. This one wore armor that was completely black, save for his left arm, which was silver. The feather plumes in his helmet were red.

You extend your hand to him.

“Princess (Y/N),” he removed his helmet and kissed your hand, “It is a pleasure to finally meet you. I am Sir James Barnes of Indianatan,” he bowed to you.

“Sir Barnes, it is a pleasure to make your acquaintance,” you nodded to him.

“The pleasure is all mine, Princess. To allow my eyes to fall upon such beauty is a true honor.”

“Thank you, Sir Barnes,” you blushed, “I look forward to watching you in the tournament. I’ve heard stories of the Winter Soldier leading troops into battle.”

“The Winter Soldier stories are much more violent than what really occurred,” Sir Barnes blushed, “Until tonight,” he kissed your hand again and walked away.

Another competitor in dark grey armor with red detailing approached the stage as soon as Sir Barnes walked away. He removed his helmet and kissed the hand you offered to him.

“Your Highness,” he bowed to you, “I am Sir Samuel Wilson of Washingshire. While we may be in competition, there is no competition for your beauty anywhere else in the surrounding lands and beyond.”

“Thank you, Sir Wilson,” you forced yourself to suppress a sigh of annoyance.

“I anxiously await the opportunity to show you my skills in jousting and combat.”

“I look forward to seeing them,” you replied.

Sir Wilson kissed your hand again and returned to the training in the middle of the field.

Throughout the afternoon each competitor came to introduce themselves to you, and each one continued to compliment your beauty and nothing else.

“I swear if I have to hear about how beautiful I am one more time I’m competing in this tournament myself and immediately declaring myself the winner,” you sighed.

“At least they’ve all been easy on the eyes themselves,” Natasha shrugged.

“You have one last competitor to meet. Maybe he will impress you?” King Nicholas said hopefully as the last knight approached you.

He wore stunning white armor that had detailings in red and blue and had matching feathers in his helmet. He lifted his helmet off as he came towards you, releasing flowing blonde hair and a dark beard. You felt a shiver run up your spine and your face turn hot as you offered him your hand.

“Princess (Y/N),” he closed his eyes and tenderly kissed your hand. “When I heard the news that kingdom was hosting a joust, I knew I had to compete for the opportunity to be privy, even for a short time, to your reputable intelligence and wit. I am Sir Steven Rogers of Brooklandia. I have also been told of your great skill in swordplay and combat. Perhaps one day I will be able to see it for myself.”

You blushed considerably, “Perhaps if I deem your skills on the battlefield worthy, I will personally duel you, Sir Rogers. And I must apologize, but I don’t believe I have heard much of your own prowess.”

“For quite some time I have been living a nomadic life, helping those who most needed it and traveling from place to place to do so. Unlike my many fierce competitors, I fear I have not made a name for myself in jousting; however, I do believe I have the skills necessary to be a worthy opponent.”

“So you are a Robin Hood sort of character?” you asked quizzically.

“I suppose so,” he replied with a booming laugh.

“Well, I quite look forward to seeing you compete,” you gave him a large smile.

“I look forward to being able to show off for you,” he said, matching your grin before bowing to you and your parents and returning to the weapons to begin sparring with Sir Wilson.

“Coulson, ensure that Sir Rogers sits next to the Princess at dinner this evening,” Queen Maria told the Lord.

“As you wish, M’Lady,” he replied.

“Perhaps dinner won’t be so bad after all,” you quietly mused to yourself.


Permanent Tag List:

@sophiealiice
trail.content:
Summary: As the king’s only daughter, you are next in line to ascend the throne of Shieldlünd. Although he knows you are capable of ruling the kingdom on your own, Royal Protocol states that you must take a husband before being allowed to reign. And so, a jousting tournament is arranged, with an assortment of handsome, eligible bachelors slated to battle for your hand in marriage.

Pairing: Knight!Steve x Princess!Reader (Plus other Avengers vying for your heart)

Words: 1553

A/N: I started this series before Call Me Doctor. and haven’t shown it much love, so I finally wrote Chapter 2. Royal AU because who doesn’t want to feel like a princess, ya know?

Catch Up On the Story Here

You walked with Natasha to the grand staircase, trying to prepare yourself for what was to come. You met your mother and father at the bottom of the staircase. Your mother held a tiara in her hands and delicately placed it upon your head. She gently held your face between her hands and gave you a loving smile. Your father hugged you tightly. Lord Coulson entered the room and bowed.

“Are we ready, Your Majesties?” he asked, rising from his bow.

“I believe so,” your father said, releasing your from his hug.

“Even if we aren’t, we have to do this anyway,” you muttered under your breath.

“Then we shall begin,” Coulson took Natasha’s arm in his own and led the way to the balcony, which overlooked the jousting field. “There is a quite the display of suitors, your highness, hopefully one will be adequate.”

You could hear cheers and yells coming from outside, and you began to feel nervous for the first time since the idea was proposed. A fanfare of trumpets began and Lord Coulson walked out onto the small stage built just for the occasion.

“Ladies and Gentleman,” he announced to the crowd, “May I present to you, His Majesty, King Nicholas and Her Majesty, Queen Maria of Shieldlünd.”

Your mother and father both kissed you on the cheek and proceeded onto the balcony to applause.

“I now have the distinct pleasure of introducing the fair maiden for whom we are all gathered: Her Royal Highness, Princess (Y/N) of Shieldlünd.”

There was silence as you walked onto the stage, holding your head high and your shoulders back. You looked out over the field and couldn’t believe the sheer amount of people who had gathered for the joust. Thunderous applause erupted as you turned to face the crowd and you made a small curtsey to them, feeling your cheeks start to blush. You took your seat and looked over the people gathered for the joust. You couldn’t see anyone in armour and turned to question your parents when Lord Coulson began to speak again.

“Your Majesties, if I may now present to the Princess the men competing for her hand in marriage?”

“Proceed,” King Nicholas directed with a wave of his hand.

“I present to you: Master James Rhodes of Philadelphus, Master Bruce Banner of Virginiandia, Sir Samuel Wilson of Washingshire, Sir James Barnes of Indianatan, Sir Steven Rogers of Brooklandia, Lord Anthony of York Newshire, and Prince Loki Laufeyson of Jotunland, Prince Thor Odinson of Asgardus.”

The 8 men rode out upon their horses to varying amounts of cheers from the crowd. You moved to the edge of your seat to get the best view of the men, although each man had his helmet on with the visor down, so you had no indication of what any of them really looked like.

“The day will begin with trials to allow our competitors time to warm-up after their long journeys to Shieldlünd. The official jousting competition will begin tomorrow. The pairings for the competition will be Prince Laufeyson versus Prince Odinson, Sir Rogers versus Master Rhodes, Lord Stark versus Master Banner, and Sir Wilson versus Sir Barnes,” Coulson announced, “For now, let the practice begin, for tomorrow, the competition commences!”

The spectators cheered and each knight bowed to you before grabbing a weapon or mounting a horse to begin the day of trials.

“I have approved each of the competitors to have small breaks to come and introduce themselves to Your Highness individually,” Coulson told you and your parents, nodding at you.

“And you have invited them to the welcoming feast?” Queen Maria asked.

“Of course, Your Majesty,” Coulson bowed.

“Welcoming feast?” you asked with a raised eyebrow.

“Um yes, it is customary to have a feast to celebrate a joust,” King Nicholas replied, “Did we forget to tell you that?” he asked with a sheepish grin.

“As you promised just a joust, I believe you did leave that out,” you crossed your arms and slumped back in your chair annoyed.

“Sit up,” Queen Maria nudged you, “One of the competitors is coming over.”

You quickly sat up and smoothed your dress down as a knight in golden armor with red feather plumes in his helmet approached the balcony. You offered him your hand as he approached and he slowly removed his helmet before taking your hand and kissing it, making direct eye contact as he did.

“Your Highness,” he bowed to you, “I am Lord Anthony Stark of York Newshire. I have heard of your beauty, but the stories are nothing compared to what I see before me.”

“Well that is very kind, Lord Stark,” you blushed, “And I am privy to your skills on the battlefield and wait with bated breath to see you joust this week.”

“I hope that I may live up to such high praises and high expectations,” Lord Stark grinned before bowing, replacing his helmet, and returning to his horse.

“I assume you’ve also heard of his skills in the bedroom,” Natasha whispered in your ear.

“Who hasn’t?” you giggled back.

“Girls, compose yourselves,” your mother snapped at you, “Another one is coming.”

Sure enough, another knight was making his way towards you. This one wore armor that was completely black, save for his left arm, which was silver. The feather plumes in his helmet were red.

You extend your hand to him.

“Princess (Y/N),” he removed his helmet and kissed your hand, “It is a pleasure to finally meet you. I am Sir James Barnes of Indianatan,” he bowed to you.

“Sir Barnes, it is a pleasure to make your acquaintance,” you nodded to him.

“The pleasure is all mine, Princess. To allow my eyes to fall upon such beauty is a true honor.”

“Thank you, Sir Barnes,” you blushed, “I look forward to watching you in the tournament. I’ve heard stories of the Winter Soldier leading troops into battle.”

“The Winter Soldier stories are much more violent than what really occurred,” Sir Barnes blushed, “Until tonight,” he kissed your hand again and walked away.

Another competitor in dark grey armor with red detailing approached the stage as soon as Sir Barnes walked away. He removed his helmet and kissed the hand you offered to him.

“Your Highness,” he bowed to you, “I am Sir Samuel Wilson of Washingshire. While we may be in competition, there is no competition for your beauty anywhere else in the surrounding lands and beyond.”

“Thank you, Sir Wilson,” you forced yourself to suppress a sigh of annoyance.

“I anxiously await the opportunity to show you my skills in jousting and combat.”

“I look forward to seeing them,” you replied.

Sir Wilson kissed your hand again and returned to the training in the middle of the field.

Throughout the afternoon each competitor came to introduce themselves to you, and each one continued to compliment your beauty and nothing else.

“I swear if I have to hear about how beautiful I am one more time I’m competing in this tournament myself and immediately declaring myself the winner,” you sighed.

“At least they’ve all been easy on the eyes themselves,” Natasha shrugged.

“You have one last competitor to meet. Maybe he will impress you?” King Nicholas said hopefully as the last knight approached you.

He wore stunning white armor that had detailings in red and blue and had matching feathers in his helmet. He lifted his helmet off as he came towards you, releasing flowing blonde hair and a dark beard. You felt a shiver run up your spine and your face turn hot as you offered him your hand.

“Princess (Y/N),” he closed his eyes and tenderly kissed your hand. “When I heard the news that kingdom was hosting a joust, I knew I had to compete for the opportunity to be privy, even for a short time, to your reputable intelligence and wit. I am Sir Steven Rogers of Brooklandia. I have also been told of your great skill in swordplay and combat. Perhaps one day I will be able to see it for myself.”

You blushed considerably, “Perhaps if I deem your skills on the battlefield worthy, I will personally duel you, Sir Rogers. And I must apologize, but I don’t believe I have heard much of your own prowess.”

“For quite some time I have been living a nomadic life, helping those who most needed it and traveling from place to place to do so. Unlike my many fierce competitors, I fear I have not made a name for myself in jousting; however, I do believe I have the skills necessary to be a worthy opponent.”

“So you are a Robin Hood sort of character?” you asked quizzically.

“I suppose so,” he replied with a booming laugh.

“Well, I quite look forward to seeing you compete,” you gave him a large smile.

“I look forward to being able to show off for you,” he said, matching your grin before bowing to you and your parents and returning to the weapons to begin sparring with Sir Wilson.

“Coulson, ensure that Sir Rogers sits next to the Princess at dinner this evening,” Queen Maria told the Lord.

“As you wish, M’Lady,” he replied.

“Perhaps dinner won’t be so bad after all,” you quietly mused to yourself.

blog.name: watchthiswatchthat
blog.title: Watch This or Watch That
blog.description: I watch movies and tell you if you should watch them or not. Also full of various movie posts. It’s a movie blog.

title: Very late update with quicklist
body:
Sorry I haven’t been active. My depression medication is stupid and unmotivating. So here’s a quicklist of movies I think I’ve seen in theatres during my absence:

Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets

I LOVED IT and critics are haters

Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2

Happened to cry since it was a month since my dad died.

Wonder Woman

That theme tho

Spiderman Homecoming

Didn’t remind me of a John Hughes movie. It was just a kid being a kid with great responsibility. 

Dunkirk

I wished I lived near a IMAX theatre when this was playing because I was immersed in that world.


Blade Runner 2049

Was in awe the whole time, don’t care for the sexuality, but beautiful and way better than the original.

Thor Ragnorok

FInally a fun Thor movie. Hated the first two but I couldn’t stop laughing and had so much fun.

The Shape of Water

Enjoyable, didn’t expect it to win Best Picture

Coco

Kind of a fun movie if your dad hadn’t past this year

Loving Vincent

not a lot of substance, but it was a beautiful experience

Black Panther

could’ve used better cinematography, but still beautiful

A Quiet Place

Tense as hell with a worthy payoff

Avengers Infinity War (part one and yall know it)

Still not over that ending even after all the great action

Solo: A Star Wars Story

the real star was Chewie

Ant Man and the Wasp

don’t remember much again apart from San Francisco and Michael Peña

I’ll have a separate post for Eighth Grade coming soon, I promise myself!

Now and forever... one and                                             the same. - Peter J. Tomasi                                                                         all spoiler posts are tagged "wednesday spoilers"                                             add me on snapchapt! taskrnaster (with an RN instead of M)

blog.name: ao3feed-tonystark
blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

title: Love Over Letters and Coffee
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2PPHb1s

by MidnightSorceress

Stephen’s a Coffee Barista, and Loki’s a College Student. Stephen’s friends suggest he try to get to know Loki and he decided he’d give it a try even though he has no idea what Loki looks like, until a pretty new face with dark long hair walked into the coffee shop, giving Stephen love letters everyday leaving no name on the letters he gives.

Stephen finds himself attracted and intrigued in the pretty male and finds himself surprised that the pretty face who keeps giving him love letters was actually the same person his friends suggested him.

And Loki is actually not the writer of the love letters, he’s just the sender. But he must admit, the guy his friend has a crush on is hot.

Problems starts, but then again, this is love.

Words: 1909, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Doctor Strange (2016), Thor (Movies), The Avengers (Marvel Movies), Marvel Cinematic Universe
  • Rating: Mature
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings

by MidnightSorceress

Stephen’s a Coffee Barista, and Loki’s a College Student. Stephen’s friends suggest he try to get to know Loki and he decided he’d give it a try even though he has no idea what Loki looks like, until a pretty new face with dark long hair walked into the coffee shop, giving Stephen love letters everyday leaving no name on the letters he gives.

Stephen finds himself attracted and intrigued in the pretty male and finds himself surprised that the pretty face who keeps giving him love letters was actually the same person his friends suggested him.

And Loki is actually not the writer of the love letters, he’s just the sender. But he must admit, the guy his friend has a crush on is hot.

Problems starts, but then again, this is love.

blog.description: ENDGAME SPOILERS!!!! Well, better get use to our new overlord... MCU blog ran by an ENTP Brit with way too much time on their hands... This blog will contain SPOILERS, NSFW context, underage tags (looking at you, non-Starker-shippers! Chill! 😂) All posts/reblogs are tagged. Any actors will be tagged as their characters. Embrace the snap and don't look back! Admin replies under username jessthequeenofstories (Tumblr is awkward with replies, sorry!)
